Exaggerate: The claim exaggerates President Ronald Reagan's efforts to build a border wall by stating that he tried for eight years, when in fact there was no discussion or attempt to build a wall during his administration.
Contradict fact: The claim contradicts the fact that President Reagan did not try to build a border wall during his presidency.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks enough support or evidence to prove that President Reagan attempted to build a border wall.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that President Reagan's failure to build a border wall is comparable to President Trump's efforts, without considering the different political contexts and circumstances.
Exist alternative explanation: The claim ignores the alternative explanation that other administrations and agencies have succeeded in building walls in sections along the U.S.-Mexico border, contradicting the notion that no progress has been made in this regard.
